author: Special Correspondent
text:
Though some members of the West Bengal Assembly on Monday demanded discussion on the developments concerning Jawaharlal Nehru University and Jadavpur University, Speaker Biman Banerjee rejected such proposal.

While Congress MLA Asit Mitra raised the demand for discussion on the JNU, MLA of Socialist Unity Centre of India (Communist) Tarun Kanti Naskar, who is also a professor at Jadavpur University, demanded that a condemnation motion be passed against the State BJP leadership for targeting the JU Vice-Chancellor.

“Between them [different political parties] lot of issues are discussed. It is not recorded. It is irrelevant,” the Speaker told journalists.

The Speaker said there was very little time in the coming session to discuss these issues.
title: Bengal Speaker rejects JNU, JU discussion
